name: The Bisa Museum
description: Bisa Abrewa Museum is a museum with sculptural representations of wood, clay, cement, paintings and photographs in Nkontompo in the Sekondi-Takoradi Metropolis of the Western Region, Ghana. The museum  has about Two thousand and two hundred artifacts relating to heroes of Africa.

name: Coast Castle
description: The Coast Castle is one of about forty 'slave castles', or large commercial forts, built on the Gold Coast of West Africa by European traders. It was originally a Portuguese 'feitoria' or trading post, established in 1555, which was named Cabo Corso.

name: Fort San Sebastian
description: Fort San Sebastian located in Shama, Ghana, is the third oldest fortification in Ghana and it was built in 1523.
